definition[0]: if someone is overwhelmed by an emotion, they feel it so strongly that they cannot think clearly
example[1]: Harriet was overwhelmed by a feeling of homesickness.
example[2]: The children were overwhelmed with excitement.
explanation[0]: Overwhelm is often passive in this meaning
definition[1]: if work or a problem overwhelms someone, it is too much or too difficult to deal with
example[3]: We were overwhelmed by the number of applications.
example[4]: They would be overwhelmed with paperwork.
explanation[1]: Overwhelm is usually passive in this meaning
definition[2]: to surprise someone very much, so that they do not know how to react
example[5]: I was completely overwhelmed by his generosity.
example[6]: We were overwhelmed by the sheer size of the place.
example[7]: In 1532 the Spaniards finally overwhelmed the armies of Peru.
definition[4]: if water overwhelms an area of land, it covers it completely and suddenly
